principles: Use data for legitimate civic transparency purposes only
Follow NYC Open Data terms of service
Protect sensitive information in logs and outputs

data_retention.logs: 30 days for operational logs, 1 year for audit logs
data_retention.cache: 24 hours for API responses, 7 days for static content

sensitive_data.personal_information: Redact from logs and public outputs
sensitive_data.draft_documents: Do not include in public releases

ethical_guidelines: Respect robots.txt and website terms of service
Implement appropriate rate limiting and delays
Use professional identification in user agents
Monitor for website changes and update accordingly
Avoid excessive load on government servers

monitoring.performance: Monitor response times and adjust delays

token_management: Store API tokens in environment variables only
Never commit tokens to version control
Rotate tokens regularly according to provider recommendations
Monitor token usage and rate limits
access_control: Limit API access to project-specific needs only
Use least-privilege principle for data access
Implement audit logging for all API calls
Validate all external data before processing
Sanitize inputs to prevent injection attacks

documentation: Maintain complete audit trail for all data sources
Cite all sources with specific dates and URLs
Version control all configuration and code changes
Preserve original source data for verification
quality_assurance: Maintain clear separation between data and analysis
Document limitations and uncertainty in findings
Enable reproducible research through clear methodology
transparency: Provide clear attribution for all sources
Respond promptly to questions about methodology

civic_ai_tools.reporting: Follow community reporting procedures for issues
civic_ai_tools.contributions: Share improvements back to community when appropriate

academic_standards.citation: Follow academic citation standards for all sources
academic_standards.data_sharing: Make non-sensitive data available for verification

data_breach: Immediately secure and isolate affected systems
Document scope and nature of potential breach
api_abuse: Immediately cease API activity if abuse suspected
Review logs to understand scope of issue
Contact API provider if rate limits exceeded
Document incident and response for future reference
data_quality: Validate suspicious data against multiple sources
Document and investigate data quality issues
Correct errors and update affected analyses
Notify users of corrections when appropriate
Improve validation procedures to prevent recurrence
